verses.roman:
'ātmārāmāś ca ātmārāmāś ca' āṭānna-bāra
śeṣe saba lopa kari' rākhi eka-bāra

synonyms: ātmārāmāḥ ca ātmārāmāḥ ca—repeating ātmārāmāḥ; āṭānna-bāra—fifty-eight times; śeṣe—at the end; saba lopa kari'-rejecting all; rākhi—we keep; eka-bāra—only one.
translation: "In this way, one can repeat the word ātmārāmāḥ with ca for each of the fifty-eight meanings. By following the rule previously stated and rejecting all but the last, we retain that which represents all the meanings.
